member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product
member.summary: Provides an overview of a single product, including information related to its support level and the latest SDK and runtime releases.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.ProductVersion
member.summary: The version of the product, e.g "5.0" or "1.1".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.EndOfLifeDate
member.summary: The end-of-life (EOL) date for this when it is considered to be out of support. The value may be if the EOL date is undetermined, e.g. when a product is still a prerelease.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.LatestReleaseIncludesSecurityUpdate
member.summary: if the latest release of the product contained a security update; otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.LatestReleaseDate
member.summary: The date of the latest release for this product.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.LatestReleaseVersion
member.summary: The version of the latest release.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.LatestRuntimeVersion
member.summary: The version of the runtime included in the latest release.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.LatestSdkVersion
member.summary: The version of the SDK included in the latest release.
member.remarks: This is usually the SDK with the highest feature band. A may include multiple SDKs across different feature bands, all of which carry the same runtime version.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.ProductName
member.summary: The name of the product.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.ReleasesJson
member.summary: The URL pointing to the releases.json file that contains information about all the releases associated with this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.ReleaseType
member.summary: A value indicating the support duration of the product.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.SupportPhase
member.summary: The current support phase of this . For an LTS release, the property should be checked to confirm whether a release is still supported.
member.remarks: The EOL dates are often published in advance, but there can be delays to updating the support phase in the published data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.IsSupported
member.summary: if the support phase is not and the current date is less than the EOL date of the product, otherwise.
member.returns: if the product is currently supported; otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.GetReleasesAsync
member.summary: Gets a collection of all releases associated with this .
member.returns: A collection of all releases for this product.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.GetReleasesAsync(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a collection of all releases associated with this using a file containing the releases data.
member.param: The path of the file containing the releases data.
When , the latest copy of the releases data is used if the online version is newer than the local file copy.
member.returns: A collection of releases associated with this .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.GetReleasesAsync(System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new collection using the releases.json file pointed to by the provided URL.
member.param: The URL pointing to the releases.json file to use.
member.returns: A collection of releases associated with this .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.IsOutOfSupport
member.summary: if the support phase is or the current date is greater than or equal to the EOL date of the product, otherwise.
member.returns: if the product is out of support; otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product.GetReleasesAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a collection of all releases defined in the specified file.
member.param: The path of the file containing the releases data.
member.returns: A collection of releases. The releases are not linked to a specific .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductCollection
member.summary: A collection of all released products.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductCollection.ReleasesIndexDefaultUrl
member.summary: The default URL of the releases index file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductCollection.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Product})
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: The list of products to include.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductCollection.GetSupportPhases
member.summary: Gets an enumerable of all the support phases across all products.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductCollection.GetAsync
member.summary: Creates a new collection of all released products using the default URL for the releases index file.
member.returns: A collection of products described in the releases index file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductCollection.GetAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new collection of all released products using the provided URL for the releases index file.
member.param: A string containing the URL pointing to the releases index file.
member.returns: A collection of products described in the releases index file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductCollection.GetAsync(System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new collection of all released products using the provided URL for the releases index file.
member.param: A URL pointing to the releases index file.
member.returns: A collection of products described in releases index file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductCollection.GetFromFileAsync(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new using the specified file containing the releases index. If the file does not exist or is outdated, a newer copy can optionally be downloaded. If the file exist and a newer copy is available it will replace the existing local copy.
member.param: The path of the releases index file.
When , if the local copy of the index is outdated, or does not exist, a new copy is downloaded, replacing the local copy before processing the file. Otherwise, the local copy is used.
member.returns: A collection of all products described by the index.
member.exception: If is and does not exist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease
member.summary: Describes a single .NET . A release may include multiple SDKs and runtime releases.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.AspNetCoreRuntime
member.summary: The ASP.NET Core runtime included in this release, or if the component is absent."/>

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.Components
member.summary: Gets a collection of all the release components (SDKs and runtimes) in the release.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.Cves
member.summary: The collection of CVEs addressed by this release. The collection may be empty if no CVEs are associated with it, typically when the release does not contain any security fixes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.Files
member.summary: Gets all files from all the release components (SDKs and runtimes) associated with this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.IsPreview
member.summary: if the release version describes a prerelease; otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.IsSecurityUpdate
member.summary: if the release includes security fixes; otherwise .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.ReleaseNotes

member.summary: The .NET runtime included with this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.Runtimes

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.Sdks
member.summary: All SDKs included in this release.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.Version
member.summary: The version of this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ProductRelease.WindowsDesktopRuntime
member.summary: The Windows desktop runtime associated with this release or if the component is absent.

A string containing the SHA512 hash of the file.
The name and extension of the file.
The RID associated with the file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseFile.DownloadAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Download this file to the specified local file and verify the file hash. If the destination file exists, the new copy is downloaded to a temporary file before verifying its hash. If the hash check fails, the temporary file is deleted. Otherwise, the temporary file is copied to the destination path. If the destination file does not exist, the file is downloaded and the hash is verified. If the hash check fails, the destination file is deleted.
member.param: The path, including the filename of the local file. The file will be overwritten if it already exists if the hash check passed.
member.exception: Thrown if the downloaded file's hash does to match the expected hash.

member.param: The object to compare to the current object.
member.returns: if the specified object is equal to the current object; otherwise.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified is equal to this instance.
member.param: The to compare to this instance.
member.returns: if the specified is equal to this instance; otherwise.

member.summary: Returns the hash code for this release file.
member.returns: A hash code for the current object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseType
member.summary: An enumeration describing different releases types based on their support duration. See the support lifecycle documentation for further details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseType.LTS
member.summary: Indicates a release is supported for the Long Term Support (LTS) timeframe (3 years).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseType.STS
member.summary: Indicates a release is supported for the Standard Term Support (STS) timeframe (18 months).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseType.Unknown
member.summary: The release type is unknown and could not be parsed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion
member.summary: Represents a version associated with a or . The version is treated as a semantic version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.PrereleasePattern
member.summary: Regular expression for capturing the pre-release part of a semantic version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.BuildMetadataPattern
member.summary: Regular expression for capturing the build-metadata part of a semantic version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.SemanticVersionPattern
member.summary: A regular expression pattern to capture a semantic version (2.0) into named groups called "major", "minor", "patch", "prerelease", and "buildmetadata".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.BuildMetadata
member.summary: The build metadata of the version or .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.Major
member.summary: The major version number.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.Minor
member.summary: The minor version number.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.Patch
member.summary: The patch number.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.Prerelease
member.summary: The prerelease label of the version or .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.SdkFeatureBand
member.summary: Gets the feature band of the version (also known as the SDK minor version). Feature bands only apply to SDK versions. The value is derived from the hundreds group of the version's patch field (third part of the version number). For example, if the SDK version is 2.1.809, the feature band is 800.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.SdkPatchLevel
member.summary: Gets the patch level of the feature band if this version is associated with an SDK. The patch level will be between 0 and 99. For example, if the SDK version is 2.1.516, the patch level is 16

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance using a string representation of a version. The version may be expressed as a semantic version.
member.param: The string value of the version, e.g. "1.0.0-preview1".
member.exception: If the string represents an invalid version.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified version components.
member.param: The major version.
The minor version.
The patch number.
The prerelease label.
The build metadata.
member.exception: Thrown if the content of any field is invalid.
Thrown if the major, minor, or patch version is less than 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.ComparePrecedenceTo(Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion)
member.summary: Compares this instance to another and returns an indication of their relative precedence. Dot-separated prerelease labels are individually compared. Versions that only differ in build metadata have the same precedence.
member.param: The to compare against this instance.
member.returns: Returns a signed integer indicating whether this instance precedes, follows or appears in the same position in the sort order as the specified .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare or null.
member.returns: Returns a signed integer indicating whether this instance precedes, follows or appears in the same position in the sort order as the parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.CompareTo(Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion)
member.summary: Compares this instance to the specified object and returns an indication of their relative values.
member.param: An object to compare.
member.returns: Returns a signed integer indicating whether this instance precedes, follows or appears in the same position in the sort order as the parameter.

member.summary: Returns a representation of the current . A specified count indicates the number of components to return.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion.Compare(Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion,Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.ReleaseVersion)
member.summary: Compare two specified objects and returns an integer that indicates their relative position in the sort order.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: A signed integer indicating the relative position in the sort order. Less than zero indicates that the first value preceeds the second. Zero indicates that both values occur at the same sort position. Greater than zero indicates that the first value follows the second.

member.summary: Tries to convert the string representation of a version to an equivalent object, and returns a value indicating whether the conversion succeeded.

member.returns: if the string could be converted; otherwise.
member.exception: If the input string is an invalid major, minor or patch value.
If is and the value is less than 0.
If is and the value exceeds .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.SupportPhase
member.summary: An enumeration describing the different support phases of a . See the support lifecycle documentation for further details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.SupportPhase.Active
member.summary: The product is in active support and will continue to receive servicing and security updates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.SupportPhase.EOL
member.summary: The product is considered end-of-life and will not receive any updates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.SupportPhase.GoLive
member.summary: A preview or release candidate that is supported in production.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.SupportPhase.Maintenance
member.summary: The product is no longer in active support and will be declared end-of-life. Only security fixes are provided until the product reaches end-of-life status.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.SupportPhase.Preview
member.summary: The product is a preview release and is unsupported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.SupportPhase.Unknown
member.summary: The support phase is unknown and could not be parsed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Utils
member.summary: Utility and helper methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Utils.IsLatestFileAsync(System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Determines if a local file is the latest version compared to an online copy.
member.param: The path of the local file.
The address pointing of the file.
member.returns: if the local file is the latest; otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Utils.DownloadFileAsync(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Downloads or copy a file from the specified address to the specified destination.
member.param: The address of the source file to download or copy.
The path of the destination file.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Utils.GetFileHash(System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm)
member.summary: Computes the hash for the specified file using the specified hash algorithm.
member.param: The path, including the filename and extension of the file to use.
The hash algorithm to use.
member.returns: A string containing the file hash.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.DotNet.Releases.Utils.GetLatestFileAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Uri)
member.summary: Checks whether a specified file exists, and if not, optionally downloads a copy from the specified address.
member.param: The path of the local file to check.
When , the latest copy of the file is downloaded if a newer version exists online.
The address of the file to download.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
